title: Tickley Monster?!?!?! Colin Is Crazy - A Conversation with Colin
description:
Who doesn't like being tickled? Colin. Why? Because when he was a kid, he'd have dreams about a handlebar mustached pedophile tickling him.

Today's topics were submitted by Greg's Mom. Leave your suggestions for future conversations in the comments below.

SUBSCRIBE/LIKE/SHARE

Every Tuesday and Thursday, roommates Greg and Colin sit down, and Greg throws a random conversation topic at Colin. In return, Colin usually says something crazy and you get a chuckle. Subscribe so you don't miss the madness.

Subscribe to our channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=gameovergreggy

Follow us on Twitter
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/gameovergreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/notaxation

#AConversationWithColin Playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL85130F65C312F61E&feature=plcp

Huge thanks to Nick and Tim for filming.

transcript_chunks.text: I probably had a Tickly Monster dream last in '91 or '92, probably. What's up everybody? Welcome to A Conversation with Colin. I'm Greg, and this is my roommate Colin. Now sometimes Colin says crazy things. So every Tuesday and Thursday, I reach into my random topic pile, pull one out, toss it at him, and we talk it out for your amusement if you like that. Like the video? Subscribe to us here and leave your comments below. Are you ready? Yes. Today's topic of conversation is what happened... if Greg tickles you. Oh God, **** it's really painful. That was submitted by my mom. I hate being tickled. I hate it. Oh God, why do you hate it so much? I... this is one reason. Why did you scream like I was going inside you? Is the better question, I think. Oh God, I'm so sensitive about being tickled. Why Cheryl knows, like even if you touch me in certain places, like very delicately touch, like I can't be touched, like on my chest or stomach, like just normally really... I can do it myself, but if someone

Cheryl knows, like even if you touch me in certain places, very delicately, I can't be touched on my chest or stomach; I can do it myself. But if someone else does, it makes me want to jump around - I hate it. So here's an interesting story: I thought I was going to tickle you, but you wouldn't react and we would end the episode. Little did I know, you'd scream like a hot poker. One of the things that I hated being tickled when I was a kid is my sisters and brother used to tickle me and tease me or whatever. Yeah, and uh, I used to have recurring nightmares about a monster called the Tickly Monster when I was a kid who would come into my dreams; he was a man with a handlebar mustache. This is the most messed up part of it all: we had these portraits in our kitchen - my dad and mom collected antiques, so they were old hand-painted things.

this is the most messed up part of it all we had these like in our kitchen we had these portraits of like all my my dad and my mom collected antiques so they were like old like hand painted things like dishes and stuff like and there were just random people right and there was this guy with a mustache like a curly mustache and he was the tickly monster in my dreams and years this thing was on the wall and I was horrified of it but like no one understood quite why until I like finally divulged the secret of the so there was this guy like even when I was in my crib like I remember this goes back like I this is like my earliest memories Jesus of this guy dressed in like khakis and like he had like this weird mustache like handlebar mustache and he would just tickle me and it was like and I would wake up all freaked out and start crying and my mom and my dad would come into my room and like get me out of my crib or out of my bed and like I'd be telling them that the Tickly Monster was

I would wake up all **** up and start crying and my mom and my dad would come into my room and like get me out of my crib or out of my bed and like I'd be telling them that the tickly monster was getting me and uh so when my siblings found out that the tickly monster was actually a portrait in our kitchen when I was a kid, it was so like they thought it was so funny and it also stems from the fact that when I was a kid I used to think that people with mustaches were strangers, like because they were like who is this guy, like this I was like he's a stranger, he has a mustache, whatever and my family interpreted this as me being that anyone with a mustache was a stranger, yeah yeah yeah so this all wrapped up in this tickling thing that I like and I still don't like being touched like in a in a soft and delicate way because it tickles me you sound delicate or you sound like a sensitive lover this must be great so so it's like yeah like you know like someone's like you know

of just breaking the plate, like blaming it on, like you're going to go in there with your Nerf dart and you hit you, you break it with your hand, and I hit it with a Nerf dart. No, no, I would have had that be reality; he would have come out of the plate then. It's like Freddy Krueger just coming out of my dreams. Yeah, all right. Well, Colin, I think that about wraps up the conversation. Thank you for your time. I know, I did. I know, well, my mom did. Thanks, Mom, for the question.
